Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony, Requirement for Ignition Interlock Device] and Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony, Requirement for Ignition Interlock Device]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony, Requirement for Ignition Interlock Device] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony, Requirement for Ignition Interlock Device] was dismissed by the court.

  • Kelley Lynn Smak was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony, Requirement for Ignition Interlock Device], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Count 2 dismissed and Count 3 merged and dismissed.
Court notes 3 days credit against ultimate sentence.
Defendant remanded to St. Croix County Jail.

In the event the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
AODA and follow any recommended treatment.

-Court authorizes Defendant's participation in the St. Croix County Drug Court.
-If Defendant participates, jurisdiction to be transferred to the Drug Court Judge.
-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

timeConds.notes:
With good time.
Huber granted for employment.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson.ADA: M. Hartung. DF ATTY:  Beau D McGraw with Atty. Petros. DF:  Kelley Lynn Smak appeared. Case called at 2:47. Atty. B. McGraw makes recommendations to joint agreement. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. PSI is waived. DE pleads guilty to Ct 1 in 14CF19. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty in Ct 1 in 14CF19. On motion of the State, Crt dismisses Ct. 2 and merge and dismiss Ct. 3.  ADA M. Hartung makes recommendations. Atty. B. McGraw makes recommendations.  
Crt orders: Sentence W/H 3 years probation with conditions:
- 330 days in St. Croix County Jail with good time. Huber is granted for employment.  3 days credidt against ultimate sentence. 
- 27 mo DL revocation credit for administrative suspension. 
- 27 mo IID
- AODA and Driver's Safety plan
- $82.50 Costs to Somerset PD
- Court authorizes DE participation to St. Croix County Drug Court. If DE participates, jurisdiction to be transferred to the drug court judge. 
- forfeiture $2072.00  to be paid through probation.
- Apply bond on file. 
- 40 hours of community service
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- DE remanded to St. Croix County Jail.
